meanings.definition: A person who is very interested in a particular subject or activity
meanings.sent1: The history buff spent hours reading about ancient civilizations.
meanings.sent2: She is a film buff and knows everything about classic movies.
meanings.sent3: The science buff was so engrossed in his experiments that he forgot to eat.
meanings.sent4: Her brother is a music buff, his knowledge of bands is impressive.
meanings.sent5: The art buff could identify the painter of any masterpiece at a glance.

meanings.definition: A pale yellowish or light brown color
meanings.sent1: The walls were painted in a warm buff color.
meanings.sent2: She chose a dress in a lovely buff shade for the party.
meanings.sent3: The buff color of the sand reminded her of a caramel latte.
meanings.sent4: The buff sky at sunset painted a beautiful scene.
meanings.sent5: The buff leaves of autumn covered the ground in a golden carpet.

meanings.definition: To polish or shine something by rubbing it
meanings.sent1: He used a soft cloth to buff the shoes until they gleamed.
meanings.sent2: She buffed the silverware to make it sparkle for the dinner party.
meanings.sent3: The maid would buff the floors until they were so shiny you could see your reflection.
meanings.sent4: The car enthusiast loved to buff his vintage car to a mirror finish.
meanings.sent5: The dancer buffed her shoes before going on stage for the performance.

meanings.definition: A soft, thick piece of cloth used for cleaning or shining
meanings.sent1: She used a buff to clean the antique furniture gently.
meanings.sent2: The maid carried a buff to wipe the dust off the shelves.
meanings.sent3: The buff was so soft that it felt like a cloud against her skin.
meanings.sent4: He grabbed a buff to wipe the fog off the mirror in the bathroom.
meanings.sent5: The car enthusiast always kept a buff handy to keep his car spotless.

meanings.definition: To make something stronger or more powerful
meanings.sent1: The coach wanted to buff up the team's defense before the big game.
meanings.sent2: She decided to buff her resume with additional certifications.
meanings.sent3: He tried to buff up his argument with more evidence.
meanings.sent4: The superhero buffed up his powers to defeat the villain.
meanings.sent5: The company aimed to buff their market presence with a new advertising campaign.
